tag-1: Citi Bahrain Hosts Middle East Research Day Event
tag-3: Manama, Bahrain – Citi hosted its Middle East Research Day event for the second year in a row at the Intercontinental Regency Hotel with the aim of sharing the views of its leading economists and analyst on the current global macroeconomic environment. The event was well received by attendees, representing leading public sector entities, corporate and financial institutions in Bahrain.
tag-4: Commenting on the Middle East Research Day event, Sharad Gupta, Corporate Banking Head for Citi in Bahrain, said: "This event will be held in more than one country in the region but began here in the Kingdom of Bahrain. It was organized with the aim of providing our clients with the opportunity to have interactive discussions with our speakers on several topics related to the global economic environment. At Citi, we invest extensive resources in providing valuable information and market insight to our clients".
tag-5: The speakers at the event included three of Citi's leading economists and analysts: Michael Saunders, Managing Director, Head of Europe Economics, Jeremy Hale, Managing Director, Head of Global Macro Strategy & Asset Allocation and Matt King, Global Head of Credit Products Strategy
tag-6: The speakers shared their views on the global macroeconomic environment in discussions that covered a range of topics including the latest global and European economic outlook, investment spending in US, Europe and Emerging Markets, the preferred asset allocation in these volatile times, cross market implications of abundant liquidity and solutions and ways to enhance yield with manageable risk.
tag-7: The analysts expect reasonable growth in the US with a tighter fiscal policy compared to that of UK, the UK economy will underperform and inflation will remain high as a result of a drop in subsidies on utilities. On investment spending in Emerging Markets, the views are that this will make up 75 percent of global investment spending in the next few years. The views shared included the reasons for market distortion due to rising debt and falling spreads & rates distortion by the central banks continuing to push for liquidity. The views were that investors should be selective in where they invest and to focus on long term risks rather than short term in light of the increased liquidity, distortions and discontinuities in the markets, and to carefully study the volatility outlook in markets before investing.
tag-8: Citi has been in the Arab world for nearly 50 years and views the region as critical to its global franchise. It currently offers full-scale corporate and investment banking services across 10 Arab countries, including Bahrain, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt, Tunisia, Morocco and Algeria.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
